content: Is it true that introverts are just shy?

Not necessarily. Shyness is often associated with feeling uncomfortable or anxious in social situations, whereas introversion is more about how a person recharges their energy. Introverts tend to feel drained after spending time in large social gatherings and prefer solitary activities to recharge, while extroverts gain energy from social interactions. So, while some introverts may be shy, many are not; they simply prefer less stimulation and more quiet time.
